title: Leather gloves
data:
**[English]()** • [中文（中国大陆）‎](/wiki/Leather_gloves/zh-CN "Leather gloves/zh-CN")

| \[ [![Leather gloves.png](/images/9/95/Leather_gloves.png)](/wiki/File:Leather_gloves.png)   \[ [![Padded gloves.png](/images/4/47/Padded_gloves.png)](/wiki/File:Padded_gloves.png)   \[ [![Riding gloves.png](/images/e/ed/Riding_gloves.png)](/wiki/File:Riding_gloves.png)   \[ [![Fencing gloves.png](/images/c/ce/Fencing_gloves.png)](/wiki/File:Fencing_gloves.png)***leather gloves |                                                               |
| -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Appearance                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   | [random](/wiki/Randomised_appearance "Randomised appearance") |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |                                                               |
| Slot                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         | [gloves](/wiki/Gloves "Gloves")                               |
| AC                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           | [1](/wiki/Armor_class "Armor class")                          |
| Special                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      | *(none)*                                                      |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |                                                               |
| Base price                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   | 8 [zm](/wiki/Zorkmid "Zorkmid")                               |
| Weight                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       | [10](/wiki/Weight "Weight")                                   |
| Material                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     | [leather](/wiki/Leather "Leather")                            |

**Leather gloves** are a type of [gloves](/wiki/Gloves "Gloves") that appear in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. They are naturally made of [leather](/wiki/Leather "Leather"), and have a [randomized appearance](/wiki/Randomized_appearance "Randomized appearance") when [unidentified](/wiki/Identification "Identification"); the default one associated with them is a pair of "old gloves".[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

Leather gloves are known as **yugake** to [Samurai](/wiki/Samurai "Samurai").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Description](#Description)

- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)
  - [3.1 Identification](#Identification)

- [4 History](#History)

- [5 Variants](#Variants)

  - [5.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [5.2 NetHack brass](#NetHack_brass)
  - [5.3 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [5.4 EvilHack](#EvilHack)

- [6 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)
  - [6.1 Yugake](#Yugake)

- [7 References](#References)

## Generation

[Healers](/wiki/Healer "Healer") start each game with a +1 pair of leather gloves, [Knights](/wiki/Knight "Knight") start the game with a +0 pair of leather gloves, and [Monks](/wiki/Monk "Monk") start each game with a +2 pair of leather gloves.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)[\[4\]](#cite_note-4) [Barbarians](/wiki/Barbarian "Barbarian"), Samurai and [Valkyries](/wiki/Valkyrie "Valkyrie") start the game with knowledge of the pair of leather gloves' randomized appearance.[\[5\]](#cite_note-5)[\[6\]](#cite_note-6)[\[7\]](#cite_note-7)

[Thugs](/wiki/Thug "Thug") have a 1⁄2 chance of [generating with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") leather gloves, and [mercenaries](/wiki/Mercenaries "Mercenaries") such as [watchmen](/wiki/Watchmen "Watchmen") and [Yendorian Army](/wiki/Yendorian_Army "Yendorian Army") soldiers will often generate with leather gloves.[\[8\]](#cite_note-8)[\[9\]](#cite_note-9)

## Description

While worn, a pair of leather gloves grants 1 base [AC](/wiki/AC "AC").

## Strategy

While lacking in perks compared to the [gauntlets of dexterity](/wiki/Gauntlets_of_dexterity "Gauntlets of dexterity") or [gauntlets of power](/wiki/Gauntlets_of_power "Gauntlets of power"), simple leather gloves are still more than sufficient enough to last you through the game and make up part of a possible [ascension kit](/wiki/Ascension_kit "Ascension kit"): any pair of gloves is enough to prevent most [footrice](/wiki/Footrice "Footrice")-related deaths (e.g. moving over a footrice corpse while [blind](/wiki/Blind "Blind") or attacking a live one bare-handed), and allows you to wield footrice corpses as weapons. If you have settled on them as your long-term gloves, you may consider using [enchant armor](/wiki/Enchant_armor "Enchant armor") scrolls on your leather gloves before other armor, since they cannot be destroyed by an unexpected [polymorph](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") (e.g, from a [polymorph trap](/wiki/Polymorph_trap "Polymorph trap")).

Soldiers, watchmen and their higher-ups are a common source of leather gloves that you can use as backups for your current pair or as material for [polypiling](/wiki/Polypiling "Polypiling").

### Identification

Leather gloves are trivial to distinguish via [price identification](/wiki/Price_identification "Price identification"), due to having a lower base cost than other randomized gloves (8[zm](/wiki/Zm "Zm") versus 50).

## History

Leather gloves first appear in [Hack 1.0](/wiki/Hack_1.0 "Hack 1.0"). From this version to [NetHack 2.3e](/wiki/NetHack_2.3e "NetHack 2.3e"), they are the only gloves present, and are known simply as a **pair of gloves**.

## Variants

Variants with [object materials](/wiki/Object_materials "Object materials") systems will usually refer to the leather gloves as a "pair of gloves" with the object's material appended (e.g. "a pair of [cloth](/wiki/Cloth "Cloth") gloves").

In variants that incorporate the [Jedi](/wiki/Jedi "Jedi") role, all Jedi start the game with a +0 pair of leather gloves.

In variants that incorporate the [Pirate](/wiki/Pirate "Pirate") role, [Mayor Cummerbund](/wiki/Mayor_Cummerbund "Mayor Cummerbund") will generate with leather gloves, as will [githyanki pirates](/wiki/Githyanki_pirate "Githyanki pirate").

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), leather gloves can be [upgraded](/wiki/Upgraded "Upgraded") into either [gauntlets of swimming](/wiki/Gauntlets_of_swimming "Gauntlets of swimming") or [gauntlets of dexterity](/wiki/Gauntlets_of_dexterity "Gauntlets of dexterity"); upgrading either of those gloves will produce leather gloves.

The [statue trap](/wiki/Statue_trap "Statue trap") of an [arch-lich](/wiki/Arch-lich "Arch-lich") in the [Lawful Quest](/wiki/Lawful_Quest "Lawful Quest") contains a cursed -1 pair of leather gloves.

### NetHack brass

In [NetHack brass](/wiki/NetHack_brass "NetHack brass"), leather gloves do not give any base AC.

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") and [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack"), leather gloves grant 0 base AC and 1 base [DR](/wiki/DR "DR") while worn - they are renamed to a "pair of gloves", and their material is always displayed. [Gauntlets](/wiki/Gauntlets_\(dNetHack\) "Gauntlets (dNetHack)") exist as a 'hard-material' counterpart to gloves.

All [Nobles](/wiki/Noble "Noble") start the game with a pair of gloves, and [dwarven](/wiki/Dwarf_\(starting_race\) "Dwarf (starting race)") [Binders](/wiki/Binder "Binder") start the game with a +0 burnt pair of gloves.

[Center of All](/wiki/Center_of_All "Center of All") is generated with a large [concordant](/wiki/Object_properties#dNetHack "Object properties") +0 pair of leather gloves.

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), [gauntlets](/wiki/Gauntlets_\(EvilHack\) "Gauntlets (EvilHack)") are also present as a 'hard-material' counterpart to leather gloves - all Knights start with gauntlets in place of leather gloves save for [Elven](/wiki/Elf_\(starting_race\) "Elf (starting race)") Knights, who retain their leather gloves due to [iron](/wiki/Iron "Iron") allergies, and [drow](/wiki/Drow_\(starting_race\) "Drow (starting race)") Knights, who are similarly averse to iron and receive [their own racial gloves](/wiki/Dark_elven_gloves "Dark elven gloves").

[Dragonbane](/wiki/Dragonbane_\(EvilHack\) "Dragonbane (EvilHack)") has its [base item](/wiki/Base_item "Base item") changed to a pair of [dragonhide](/wiki/Dragonhide "Dragonhide") gloves.

## Encyclopedia entry

### Yugake

Japanese leather archery gloves. Gloves made for use while  
practicing had thumbs reinforced with horn. Those worn into  
battle had thumbs reinforced with a double layer of leather.

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/objects.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 497](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/objects.c#L497)
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [src/u\_init.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 61](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/u_init.c#L61)
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [src/u\_init.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 79](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/u_init.c#L79)
4. [↑](#cite_ref-4) [src/u\_init.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 86](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/u_init.c#L86)
5. [↑](#cite_ref-5) [src/u\_init.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 688](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/u_init.c#L688)
6. [↑](#cite_ref-6) [src/u\_init.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 764](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/u_init.c#L764)
7. [↑](#cite_ref-7) [src/u\_init.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 786](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/u_init.c#L786)
8. [↑](#cite_ref-8) [src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 315](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/makemon.c#L315)
9. [↑](#cite_ref-9) [src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 647](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/makemon.c#L647)

html:
Leather gloves

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
English

 • 中文（中国大陆）‎
[    [    [    [ 
leather gloves
Appearance random
Slot gloves
AC 1
Special (none)
Base price 8 zm
Weight 10
Material leather

Leather gloves are a type of gloves that appear in NetHack. They are naturally made of leather, and have a randomized appearance when unidentified; the default one associated with them is a pair of "old gloves".[1]

Leather gloves are known as yugake to Samurai.

Contents

  • 1 Generation
  • 2 Description
  • 3 Strategy
    • 3.1 Identification
  • 4 History
  • 5 Variants
    • 5.1 SLASH'EM
    • 5.2 NetHack brass
    • 5.3 dNetHack
    • 5.4 EvilHack
  • 6 Encyclopedia entry
    • 6.1 Yugake
  • 7 References

Generation

Healers start each game with a +1 pair of leather gloves, Knights start the game with a +0 pair of leather gloves, and Monks start each game with a +2 pair of leather gloves.[2][3][4] Barbarians, Samurai and Valkyries start the game with knowledge of the pair of leather gloves' randomized appearance.[5][6][7]

Thugs have a 1⁄2 chance of generating with leather gloves, and mercenaries such as watchmen and Yendorian Army soldiers will often generate with leather gloves.[8][9]

Description

While worn, a pair of leather gloves grants 1 base AC.

Strategy

While lacking in perks compared to the gauntlets of dexterity or gauntlets of power, simple leather gloves are still more than sufficient enough to last you through the game and make up part of a possible ascension kit: any pair of gloves is enough to prevent most footrice-related deaths (e.g. moving over a footrice corpse while blind or attacking a live one bare-handed), and allows you to wield footrice corpses as weapons. If you have settled on them as your long-term gloves, you may consider using enchant armor scrolls on your leather gloves before other armor, since they cannot be destroyed by an unexpected polymorph (e.g, from a polymorph trap).

Soldiers, watchmen and their higher-ups are a common source of leather gloves that you can use as backups for your current pair or as material for polypiling.

Identification

Leather gloves are trivial to distinguish via price identification, due to having a lower base cost than other randomized gloves (8zm versus 50).

History

Leather gloves first appear in Hack 1.0. From this version to NetHack 2.3e, they are the only gloves present, and are known simply as a pair of gloves.

Variants

Variants with object materials systems will usually refer to the leather gloves as a "pair of gloves" with the object's material appended (e.g. "a pair of cloth gloves").

In variants that incorporate the Jedi role, all Jedi start the game with a +0 pair of leather gloves.

In variants that incorporate the Pirate role, Mayor Cummerbund will generate with leather gloves, as will githyanki pirates.

SLASH'EM

In SLASH'EM, leather gloves can be upgraded into either gauntlets of swimming or gauntlets of dexterity; upgrading either of those gloves will produce leather gloves.

The statue trap of an arch-lich in the Lawful Quest contains a cursed -1 pair of leather gloves.

NetHack brass

In NetHack brass, leather gloves do not give any base AC.

dNetHack

In dNetHack and notdNetHack, leather gloves grant 0 base AC and 1 base DR while worn - they are renamed to a "pair of gloves", and their material is always displayed. Gauntlets exist as a 'hard-material' counterpart to gloves.

All Nobles start the game with a pair of gloves, and dwarven Binders start the game with a +0 burnt pair of gloves.

Center of All is generated with a large concordant +0 pair of leather gloves.

EvilHack

In EvilHack, gauntlets are also present as a 'hard-material' counterpart to leather gloves - all Knights start with gauntlets in place of leather gloves save for Elven Knights, who retain their leather gloves due to iron allergies, and drow Knights, who are similarly averse to iron and receive their own racial gloves.

Dragonbane has its base item changed to a pair of dragonhide gloves.

Encyclopedia entry

Yugake

Japanese leather archery gloves. Gloves made for use while
practicing had thumbs reinforced with horn. Those worn into
battle had thumbs reinforced with a double layer of leather.

References

  1. ↑ src/objects.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 497
  2. ↑ src/u_init.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 61
  3. ↑ src/u_init.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 79
  4. ↑ src/u_init.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 86
  5. ↑ src/u_init.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 688
  6. ↑ src/u_init.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 764
  7. ↑ src/u_init.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 786
  8. ↑ src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 315
  9. ↑ src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 647

'''Leather gloves''' are a type of [[gloves]] that appear in ''[[NetHack]]''. They are naturally made of [[leather]], and have a [[randomized appearance]] when [[Identification|unidentified]]; the default one associated with them is a pair of "old gloves".{{refsrc|src/objects.c|497|version=NetHack 3.6.7}}

Leather gloves are known as '''yugake''' to [[Samurai]].

==Generation==
[[Healer]]s start each game with a +1 pair of leather gloves, [[Knight]]s start the game with a +0 pair of leather gloves, and [[Monk]]s start each game with a +2 pair of leather gloves.{{refsrc|src/u_init.c|61|nethack=3.6.7}}{{refsrc|src/u_init.c|79|nethack=3.6.7}}{{refsrc|src/u_init.c|86|nethack=3.6.7}} [[Barbarian]]s, Samurai and [[Valkyrie]]s start the game with knowledge of the pair of leather gloves' randomized appearance.{{refsrc|src/u_init.c|688|nethack=3.6.7}}{{refsrc|src/u_init.c|764|nethack=3.6.7}}{{refsrc|src/u_init.c|786|nethack=3.6.7}}

[[Thug]]s have a {{frac|2}} chance of [[Monster starting inventory|generating with]] leather gloves, and [[mercenaries]] such as [[watchmen]] and [[Yendorian Army]] soldiers will often generate with leather gloves.{{refsrc|src/makemon.c|315|nethack=3.6.7}}{{refsrc|src/makemon.c|647|nethack=3.6.7}}

==Description==
While worn, a pair of leather gloves grants 1 base [[AC]].

==Strategy==
While lacking in perks compared to the [[gauntlets of dexterity]] or [[gauntlets of power]], simple leather gloves are still more than sufficient enough to last you through the game and make up part of a possible [[ascension kit]]: any pair of gloves is enough to prevent most [[footrice]]-related deaths (e.g. moving over a footrice corpse while [[blind]] or attacking a live one bare-handed), and allows you to wield footrice corpses as weapons. If you have settled on them as your long-term gloves, you may consider using [[enchant armor]] scrolls on your leather gloves before other armor, since they cannot be destroyed by an unexpected [[polymorph]] (e.g, from a [[polymorph trap]]).

Soldiers, watchmen and their higher-ups are a common source of leather gloves that you can use as backups for your current pair or as material for [[polypiling]].

===Identification===
Leather gloves are trivial to distinguish via [[price identification]], due to having a lower base cost than other randomized gloves (8[[zm]] versus 50).

==History==
Leather gloves first appear in [[Hack 1.0]]. From this version to [[NetHack 2.3e]], they are the only gloves present, and are known simply as a '''pair of gloves'''.

==Variants==
Variants with [[object materials]] systems will usually refer to the leather gloves as a "pair of gloves" with the object's material appended (e.g. "a pair of [[cloth]] gloves").

In variants that incorporate the [[Jedi]] role, all Jedi start the game with a +0 pair of leather gloves.

In variants that incorporate the [[Pirate]] role, [[Mayor Cummerbund]] will generate with leather gloves, as will [[githyanki pirate]]s.

===SLASH'EM===
In [[SLASH'EM]], leather gloves can be [[upgraded]] into either [[gauntlets of swimming]] or [[gauntlets of dexterity]]; upgrading either of those gloves will produce leather gloves.

The [[statue trap]] of an [[arch-lich]] in the [[Lawful Quest]] contains a cursed -1 pair of leather gloves.

===NetHack brass===
In [[NetHack brass]], leather gloves do not give any base AC.

===dNetHack===
In [[dNetHack]] and [[notdNetHack]], leather gloves grant 0 base AC and 1 base [[DR]] while worn - they are renamed to a "pair of gloves", and their material is always displayed. [[Gauntlets (dNetHack)|Gauntlets]] exist as a 'hard-material' counterpart to gloves.

All [[Noble]]s start the game with a pair of gloves, and [[Dwarf (starting race)|dwarven]] [[Binder]]s start the game with a +0 burnt pair of gloves.

[[Center of All]] is generated with a large [[Object properties#dNetHack|concordant]] +0 pair of leather gloves.

===EvilHack===
In [[EvilHack]], [[Gauntlets (EvilHack)|gauntlets]] are also present as a 'hard-material' counterpart to leather gloves - all Knights start with gauntlets in place of leather gloves save for [[Elf (starting race)|Elven]] Knights, who retain their leather gloves due to [[iron]] allergies, and [[Drow (starting race)|drow]] Knights, who are similarly averse to iron and receive [[Dark elven gloves|their own racial gloves]].

[[Dragonbane (EvilHack)|Dragonbane]] has its [[base item]] changed to a pair of [[dragonhide]] gloves.

==Encyclopedia entry==

Japanese leather archery gloves.  Gloves made for use while
practicing had thumbs reinforced with horn.  Those worn into
battle had thumbs reinforced with a double layer of leather.
